Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Bowl
Description: Bowl with flat base, carinated body and an S-shaped unrestricted mouth. The lip is tapered. The clay is fine, compact, well fired and polished. This vessel was licked by the flames, which give it its blackened look.
